page.title: 14Shireoaks Manor
page.content: {Shireoaks Manor}or{Hall}is at present derelict. It was built by{Thomas {Hewett,}who became{Sheriff of {Nottingham,}in about 1610. His grandson, another Thomas, who was Surveyor of Works for{Queen Anne}and {George 1}around 1700, lived in the Manor after that. The family originally came from{Wales,}near {Kiveton Park.}They made their money as wool merchants in London and one member of the family,{William Hewett, became{Lord Mayor of London}in the reign of{Elizabeth 1.}The house was designed with a canal, and six water gardens, which are still in existence today although not as impressive as they were then. At the moment the {coach houses and stables,}which were converted to cottages in 1914, are being restored to their original state for use as a refreshment centre.
